definition.text: New Zealand is a sovereign island nation in Oceania composed primarily of the North and South Islands. It operates as a parliamentary democracy and constitutional monarchy. Historically shaped by MƒÅori settlement and later British colonization, New Zealand developed a high-income, export-oriented economy centered on agriculture, agri-technology, tourism, and services, with strong institutional quality and regulatory transparency.

works.title: Actor Set Evolution of New Zealand
works.description: Temporal mapping of New Zealand‚Äôs actor space from MƒÅori polities and colonial administration to welfare-state expansion, economic liberalization (post-1984 reforms), and contemporary regulatory institutions.

works.title: Agricultural and Trade Network Structure
works.description: Network analysis of dairy, meat, forestry, and agri-technology sectors, including export linkages to Asia-Pacific markets.

works.title: Regional Spatial-Administrative Structure
works.description: Geospatial representation of regions, major urban centers, infrastructure networks, and environmental management systems.
